required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: COMParison of Algorithms for Rotational Evaluation in Atrial Fibrillation
clinical_study.official_title: COMParison of Algorithms for Rotational Evaluation in Atrial Fibrillation

brief_summary.textblock: This is a cohort study to evaluate algorithms for mapping atrial fibrillation and for detecting rotational activity.

detailed_description.textblock:
In this study, the investigators will analyze electrograms collected routinely at clinical electrophysiology study (EPS) in patients undergoing ablation for atrial fibrillation. These electrograms will be recorded from a variety of clinically approved catheters under standard of care conditions, and will be analyzed to better understand the mechanisms for atrial fibrillation and its relationship to outcomes.
The investigators anticipate analyzing data from 200 patients through December 2017.

primary_outcome.description: Comparing mapping systems to diagnose sites of importance in Atrial Fibrillation

study_pop.textblock: The investigators will study adults aged 21-90 years who have undergone electrophysiology study for ablation of Atrial Fibrillation. De-identified datasets will be made available for comparisons of mapping approaches.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- aged 21-80 yrs who underwent electrophysiology study for ablation of Atrial Fibrillation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Poor data quality of recordings of AF
